metadata.feature_description: View and track which content items (pages, files) are using specific workflows.

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Workflow in PersonaBar
steps.expected: Workflows page should display with list of available workflows
steps.actual: Workflows page displayed showing 4 workflows: Direct Publish, Save Draft, Content Approval, and Test Workflow

steps.action: Click on Direct Publish workflow to expand it
steps.expected: Workflow details should expand showing description and 'View Usage' link for in-use workflows
steps.actual: Direct Publish workflow expanded showing description 'Allows an author to directly publish content to the site', message 'This workflow is currently in use', and 'View Usage' link

steps.expected: Dialog should open showing resources using the Direct Publish workflow
steps.actual: Dialog opened with title 'Workflow Usage Information' and subtitle 'You are viewing usage for the Direct Publish workflow'. Resources displayed in a table with NAME and CONTENT TYPE columns

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify resource count accuracy (pagination loads 20 items)

steps.action: Count resources displayed in the resources dialog
steps.expected: Resources should be displayed with pagination (20 items per page based on code)
steps.actual: 20 resources displayed in initial load: 6 Evoq Publisher Posts and 14 Folders. This matches the ResourcesSteps=20 constant in WorkflowsController.cs

steps.action: Examine resource types in the CONTENT TYPE column
steps.expected: Resource types should be displayed correctly (e.g., Page, Folder, etc.)
steps.actual: Two resource types observed: 'Evoq Publisher Post' and 'Folder'. The types are displayed correctly in the CONTENT TYPE column

steps.action: Examine resource titles in the NAME column
steps.expected: Resource names should be displayed accurately matching the actual content names
steps.actual: Resource titles displayed correctly including: 'First Test Post About Technology', 'Revision Test Post', 'Tech News and Innovation', 'Test Blog Post - Post Creation and Editing Feature', 'Test Post for Author Management', 'Test Post for Social Sharing', and folder paths like '/', '/Badges/', '/Groups/', '/Images/', etc.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test empty resource list for unused workflow

steps.action: Close resources dialog and expand 'Test Workflow' (which has no checkmark in IN USE column)
steps.expected: Unused workflow should not display 'View Usage' link since there are no resources using it
steps.actual: Test Workflow expanded but does NOT show the 'This workflow is currently in use' message or 'View Usage' link. The IN USE column has no checkmark for this workflow. This is expected behavior - the View Usage link only appears for workflows that are in use.

observations: The Resources API endpoint uses pagination with 20 items per page (ResourcesSteps = 20 in WorkflowsController.cs line 32).
Content type 'Tab' is displayed as 'Page' in the UI (code converts 'Tab' to 'Page' in content-workflows.js line 440).
The 'View Usage' link only appears for workflows where IsInUse is true.
Lazy loading is implemented for pagination - scrolling to the bottom of the resource list triggers loading more items.
The resources dialog uses jScrollPane for custom scrolling with lazy load detection.
